title-group.article-title: Odd Perfect Numbers Have at Least Nine Distinct Prime Factors

abstract.p: An odd perfect number, N, is shown to have at least nine distinct prime factors. If 3 ∤ N then N must have at least twelve distinct prime divisors. The proof ultimately avoids previous computational results for odd perfect numbers.
